page.title: 10HISTORY OF TATTON
page.content: THE DOMESDAY BOOK RECORDED TATUNE UNDER TWO ENTRIES HAVING SAXON LORDS EGBRAND AND LEOFWIN, OCCUPIED BY 5 VILLAGERS AND 8 SMALLHOLDERS WITH PLOUGHLAND, PASTURE AND WOODS. {EXCAVATIONS} CARRIED OUT RECENTLY BY MANCHESTER UNIVERSITY HAVE REVEALED EVIDENCE OF FARMING 5000 YEARS AGO AND FLINTS FROM EVEN EARLIER HAVE BEEN FOUND ON A SITE NEAR THE MERE. FROM ABOUT 1280 THE MASSEYS WERE LORDS OF TATTON AND KNUTSFORD FOR OVER 200 YEARS. PART OF{THE DEER PARK}DATES BACK TO THIS TIME. IN MEDIEVAL TIMES TATTON WAS A VILLAGE COMMUNITY WITH MILL, ALE HOUSE AND SCHOOL. AS LATE AS 1733 THE AREA WAS LAID OUT IN NAMED FIELDS AND CROFTS BUT FROM THAT TIME EMPARKMENT BEGAN.THE MEDIEVAL TRAIL HAS BEEN PLANNED TO INTERPRET THE LANDSCAPE WITH SUNKEN ROAD AND HOUSE PLATFORMS POINTED OUT.
